channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NV
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NV

item.title: Report E-2024030577
item.description:
Report E-2024030577

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: SPARKS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal URE experienced a UN1830 Sulfuric Acid ACS release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons of product released to a 23’ x 10’ area of the wooden/metal trailer floor and walls along with a 35’ x 10’ area of the asphalt lot below the trailer. The release was caused due to a forklift puncture. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one for shipment on. Absorbents & sodium bicarb were deployed and worked into the impacted areas to clean and neutralize the release. The impacted absorbents were collected into (11) 55-gallon poly drums. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with the impacted pallets into 4 supersacks. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage

item.title: Report X-2024031323
item.description:
Report X-2024031323

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-22
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package Handler notice HazMat box was wet and notified manager. Manager while wearing gloves secured box in Hazmat lined tote and delivered it to the QA. DescribePack: 1 - 4 liter glass jug broken open. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Secured the Box in a hazmat lined tote.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was removed from belt slipped and dropped. The box was placed in a lined hazmat tote. Delivered to QA by manager. DescribePack: The plastic bucket in the Box split down the length of the bucket. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Taped the seams of the box. Contained in the plastic lined tote.
